messages.title: A real record of fighting for Ealing Central and Acton
messages.content: Campaigning against Labour-run Ealing Council's plans to close Solace Centre, fought plans to close Carlton Road Day Centre, worked to deliver 1790 apprenticeships.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Lib Dems made bringing down the cost of living a top priority, achieving £800 income tax cut.
Introduced free early years childcare for all 3 and 4-year-olds, plan to extend free childcare to all 2-year-olds as well.

1 in 4 young people in the UK suffer from some kind of mental illness. The Lib Dems have pledged to tackle mental health and have ordered an extra £500 million nationwide to make sure it is treated seriously.
Have stopped various Conservative plans including cutting schools, nurseries and colleges budget, and policies like fire at will and running schools for profit.

issues.education: Lib Dems plan to extend free childcare to all 2-year-olds and protect schools, nurseries and colleges from budget cuts.
issues.health: Tackling mental health with an additional £500 million nationwide

housing.content: Lib Dems made bringing down the cost of living a priority, have stopped plans that threaten housing security such as the fire at will policy.

leaflet.personalStatement: Jon Ball has worked tirelessly for residents as a councillor for 13 years and now wants to represent you in Parliament.

politicalExperience.achievements: Campaigning against closure of local centers, delivering apprenticeships.

endorsements.endorsement: Liam's free childcare is great, helps to cover more of my expenses.
Noticed the difference since Lib Dems fought for the income tax cut.
Witnessed the human cost of the health issue, thankful it's finally being taken seriously.

images.caption: Jon Ball with constituents on public transit.
